title: Захарова рассказала об ответных мерах на санкции США против российских СМИ
cleaned_sentences: Russia is working on retaliatory measures after the united states of sanctions against a number of Russian media, including against Russia Today and Sputnik.
This was said by RIA Novosti by the official representative of the Foreign Ministry of the Russian Federation Maria Zakharova.
“Of course, it will all be developed, worked out,” she emphasized.

Speaking about the sanctions introduced against Russian media, the official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry noted that they are a “hybrid scheme”, which is not fully understood even in the United States.
“That is, some part is voiced, and some part is still somewhere there, apparently, is either finalized, or somewhere else under the table lies,” she explained.

On September 4, it became known that the Ministry of Finance of the United States imposes sanctions against RT, the editor -in -chief of the TV channel Margarita Simonyan and its deputy Anton Anisimov and Elizabeth Brodskaya.
Andrei Kiyashko, head of the digital media projects, Konstantin Kalashnikov and an employee of the digital media projects Elena Afanasyeva, fell under the sanctions.
In addition, the Ministry of Finance of the United States banned data transfer to the first channel, Russia 1 and NTV, Algorithm, New Eastern Review magazine and ANO Dialog without permission.
Earlier, Scott Ritter announced the termination of work with Russia Today and Sputnik.
